page.description: Find a value in the array, return the index of the entry, or 0 if not found.
page.syntax: Index as N = <ARRAY>.find(A key[,C options[,N Starting]])

argument.name: key
argument.description: A value to find in the array.

argument.name: options
argument.description: An Xbasic expression that processes the array element before the find operation.

argument.name: Starting
argument.description: The index of the first array element to search.

discussion.p: The <ARRAY>.FIND() method finds an element in a single dimensional array and returns its Index number.

In the case of a character, numeric, or logical array, Options can be used to search on a value derived from the array entry. For example, setting options to "*[xb:word(value, 1)]*" searches on the first word of each entry. Setting Options to "*[xb:lower(value)]*" makes the search case insensitive.

section.note: "Value" is a special keyword that refers to the value in the current array element.

section.description: In the case of a property array, options specifies which array property to search. For example:

section.example: dim a[2] as P a[1].NAME = "sam" a[1].city = "boston" a[2].NAME = "celine" a[2].city = "ithaca" ? a.find("celine","name") = 2.000000

section.description: A simpler syntax introduced in Alpha Five version 11 that does a case-insensitive search is supported if the keyword is "index".
section.example: dim a[3] as P a[1].index = "alpha" a[2].index= "beta" a[3].index = "Gamma" ? a.find(ut("gamma"),"ut(index)") 'old style = 3 ? a.find("gamma") 'new style = 3

section.title: Examples
section.example: dim A[2] as C A[1] = "fred" A[2] = "john" ? A.find("john") = 2

section.description: Assume you have the following array and want to search for sub-strings.
section.example: dim company[2] as C company[1] = "Alpha Software Corporation" company[2] = "International Computer Machines"

section.description: The following command searches for the array entry that contains the word "Software".
section.example:
string = "Software" ? company.find(string,"word(value,word_FROM_pos(value,at(string,value)))") = 1
string = "software" ? company.find(string,"word(value,word_FROM_pos(value,at(string,value)))") = 0
'above does not find the string because search is case-sensitive 'to perform a case-insensitive search use atc() ? company.find(lower(string),"lower(word(value,word_FROM_pos(value,atc(string,value))))") = 1
'The following command search for a substring. string = "uter" ? company.find(string,"iif(occurs(string,value)>0,string,\"\")") = 2
